data.title: Legal perspective: Khao Kradong Land – national asset or private property?"
data.description: Following the order from the Director-General of the Department of Lands to establish an investigative committee to examine land title deeds issued over the property of the State Railway of Thailand (SRT) in the Khao Kradong area, Mueang District, Buriram Province—totalling 995 deeds—pursuant to the judgment of the Central Administrative Court, officials from the Buriram Provincial Land Office and other representatives of the SRT conducted a survey of the Khao Kradong area, covering 5,083 rai of SRT land.

data.title: Theppadungporn Coconut offers rehab funds to flood-affected schools
data.description: Theppadungporn Coconut has offered funding of 200,000 baht per school to 50 schools affected by this year’s floods to rehabilitate their premises under its “Love Sharing” project.

data.title: Fields of gold: Bua tong blooms in Mae Hong Son
data.description: Visitors to the northern province will be mesmerised by the yellow flowers that carpet the slopes of Doi Mae U Kho

data.title: Worries over increasing Chinese imports under Trump presidency
data.description: Plagued by increased tariffs under Trump, China likely to use Thailand as an export outlet to the US, business leader warns

data.title: Narathiwat mayor gunned down by four men
data.description: Popular two-term mayor of Rueso subdistrict fatally shot while in a meeting at his garment factory in troubled South

data.title: Explains "Rodtang" failed to Weigh in, lost ONE World Championship
data.description: Rodtang Jitmuangnon failed to weigh in for the second time, losing another ONE Flyweight Muay Thai World Championship belt, but he still got to fight. Let's take a look at why.

data.title: Cambodian fragrant rice wins "World’s Best Rice" award for sixth time
data.description: Cambodian fragrant rice has been selected once again as the “World’s Best Rice” at the 2024 International World Rice Conference in Manila, Philippines on November 7. This marks the sixth time the country has won this prestigious international award.

data.title: DSI expands "Mae Mon" gambling probe, Seizes assets worth 300 million baht
data.description: Pol Lt Col Yutthana Praedam, Acting Director-General of the Department of Special Investigation (DSI), held a press conference on Thursday (November 7, 2024) to announce the progress of the DSI’s investigation into the “Mae Mon” online gambling network.

data.title: Nation TV anchor files defamation lawsuit against lawyer Sittha
data.description: The lawsuit accuses Sittha Biabungkerd of falsely claiming a certain politician had paid the anchor to cover news of his 71-million baht embezzlement case

data.title: CSD seeks to deny bail for lawyer, wife in 71m baht embezzlement case
data.description: Famous lawyer Sittha Biabungkerd and his wife were arrested while allegedly fleeing to escape charges of fraud and money laundering

data.title: Chinese EV-makers offer discounts to boost their year-end sales
data.description: Chinese electric vehicle (EV) manufacturers are offering new models and up to 100,000 baht discounts in a bid to stimulate sales in the remainder of this year, according to a Thansettakij report on Thursday.

data.title: Special Presentation: Rediscovering extraordinary classics
data.description: The “Special Presentation” category of the 16th World Film Festival of Bangkok, which launches today, features timeless classics that have been restored for a glorious return to the big screen.

data.title: Financial Literacy 101: Understanding and Applying Sustainable Investment
data.description: Financial literacy is needed now more than ever to navigate with any confidence a fast-moving world where obstacles and pitfalls abound. More and more schools around the world have begun to recognize this, their curricula evolving accordingly to equip the next generation with a level of financial acumen suited to these times.

data.title: Watch industry failing to make models women want - survey
data.description: GENEVA — The watch industry is not producing and marketing enough models that women want to wear, a survey has found.
